entry.summary: Insecure deserialization is a common vulnerability (OWASP TOP10) that very often leads to arbitrary code execution. Today, I'm going to explain how to turn a seemingly harmless deserialization into code execution.

entry.summary: PowerShell was designed to help automate IT tasks, and does it very well! PowerShell handles those mundane tasks that we as developers absolutely loathe. This article isn't meant as a course on PowerShell, so I challenge you to start learning more and using it.

entry.title: PowerShell - Logging
entry.summary: Something overlooked in scripting is the value of logging your result. Typically when most system administrators write something in PowerShell they are attempting to achieve a desired result. When the desired result is achieved, why log the steps taken?

entry.title: Secure Your Software Supply Chain – Trusting Third Parties
entry.summary: In this first post we discuss publishers, trust, and measurements. In part two the focus is on technical threats and mitigations surrounding third-party components.

entry.summary: The Fourth of July weekend REvil ransomware attack that crippled hundred of organizations.

entry.title: How the Kaseya VSA Zero-Day Exploit Worked
entry.summary: This article explains the pre-auth remote code execution exploit against Kaseya VSA Server that was used in the mass Revil ransomware attack on July 2, 2021.

entry.summary: Threat actors operate at all times, even outside business hours. Once in, it takes less than a few hours for a threat actor to take control of an entire IT environment.

entry.summary: Knock knock, who's there? Your new DA!

entry.title: When the Cyber Threat Comes From the Inside
entry.summary: Would you like to earn millions of dollars? The LockBit 2.0 ransomware is now trying to recruit insiders – and there is no reason to believe that your company wouldn’t be targeted.

entry.title: Test Your Company's IT Defenses: Conduct a Cyber Threat Assessment
entry.summary: How well can your organization detect, defend, and respond to a cyber attack? Find out with a Red Team exercise.

entry.title: Threat Intelligence Report 2021
entry.summary: The number of ransom attacks has tripled during 2020, and the cost of cybercrime in Sweden is now exceeding 30 billion SEK per year.

entry.title: A Ciso's Guide to Incident Readiness
entry.summary: Did you know that a majority of Swedish companies don’t have a strategy for handling a cyber attack? Prepare for the real threats and stay ahead with a contingency plan – download our checklist for incident readiness.

entry.title: Kaseya Supply Chain Attack Targeting MSPs to Deliver REvil Ransomware
entry.summary: Kaseya VSA, a product commonly used by MSPs to manage their clients' IT environments, It was used as part of a supply chain attack delivering REvil ransomware to thousands of organizations.

entry.title: UAParser.js npm Package Supply Chain Attack: Impact and Response
entry.summary: UAParser.js, a popular project with 7 million downloads weekly, was hijacked to deliver malware in a supply chain attack. This article describes the key elements of the attack, and how to determine if you were affected.

entry.title: ProxyShell, QBot, and Conti Ransomware Combined in a Series of Cyber Attacks
entry.summary: We are investigating a series of cyber attacks that result in encryption with the Conti ransomware. This post describes some of the indicators that can be used to detect these attacks.

entry.title: Common Active Directory Misconfiguration
Log4Shell / Apache Log4j Injection Vulnerability CVE-2021-44228: Impact and Response
entry.summary: Apache Log4j is a very popular logging framework used in all sorts of Java applications including servers, clients, appliances, and network monitoring software. Logging attacker-controlled data can under common circumstances lead to Remote Code Execution, giving the attacker access to the running environment, as well as other attack vectors.

entry.title: Log4j - How To Secure Your VMware Horizon, UAG and vCenter Servers Against the Log4Shell Vulnerability (CVE-2021-44228)
entry.summary: Log4Shell is a critical (10.0 CVSS) vulnerability that affects thousands of products running Apache Log4j. VMware vCenter Server, Horizon and VMware UAG (Unified Access Gateway) are some of them and since Horizon/UAG are sometimes reachable from the entire internet, they will most likely get attacked if they're not urgently secured.

entry.title: Using a Legitimate Application to Create Persistence in Your Azure Active Directory
entry.summary: ﻿﻿In a recent incident response engagement, we identified a threat actor using a legitimate enterprise application to perform malicious email campaigns towards the affected environment.

entry.title: Log4j/Log4Shell Explained - All You Need to Know
entry.summary: On the December 9, 2021, a vulnerability, CVE-2021-44228, was disclosed concerning Apache Log4j, a popular open-source library. The vulnerability allows remote code execution and has been assigned the highest possible severity of 10.0.

entry.title: Vulnerability Analysis of CVE-2022-21907 - HTTP Protocol Stack RCE
entry.summary: A potentially very serious vulnerability has been discovered (and patched) in HTTP.sys, a kernel mode device driver in Microsoft Windows responsible for managing HTTP-requests to and from various system services and subsystems.

entry.title: State-Sponsored Cyber Attacks Against Ukraine
entry.summary: In this investigation, Truesec Threat Intelligence Unit have analyzed the cyber attacks against Ukraine January 13-16, 2022, and the events surrounding them.

entry.title: What Do Drones Have To Do With Social Engineering and Recruited Spies?
entry.summary: In this blog, we reflect on the recent news of drones observed flying in restricted areas across Sweden, and how this might be connected to the deteriorating security situation in Europe. But also, the growing challenges of hybrid warfare, using methods including both technical and human intelligence.

entry.title: Current cyber threat situation in Sweden
entry.summary: Together, we will provide Swedish organizations the conditions to prevent data breaches by working data-driven with the risks linked to cyber threats.

entry.title: Threats to the Swedish Financial Sector in 2021
entry.summary: Get in the driver's seat of preparing your organization against the cyber threats most likely to hit the financial industry. Learn from the analysis and follow our recommendations.

entry.title: Threat Intelligence Report 2022
entry.summary: A shift in tactics has led to an enormous upswing for cybercrime, and it's not going away any time soon. In our 2022 Threat Intelligence Report, you'll gain firsthand insight into the evolving cyber threat landscape and how to prioritize your cybersecurity efforts in the coming year.

entry.title: A First Step Towards Building a Cyber Threat Intelligence Capability
entry.summary: Threat intelligence is, at its core, about providing you with a knowledge advantage, which enables you to direct your resources where they are most effective. Use threat intelligence to guide your cyber security program and enable a more responsive and adaptable cyber defense.

entry.title: Increased Cyber Threat to Critical Infrastructure
entry.summary: With the appalling Russian invasion of Ukraine, the risk of an economic war between Russia and the West has increased dramatically. Such a conflict could involve cyber attacks on critical infrastructure in Western countries.

entry.title: Increased Risk of DDoS Attacks
entry.summary: There have been many DDoS attacks in conjunction with the war in Ukraine. As the risk of widening cyber conflict increases, it is important to know how to defend your organization.

entry.title: FIN12/Conti Syndicate Use TeamTNT Tools in Ransomware Attacks
entry.summary: Truesec can now confirm that a ransomware syndicate known as FIN12/Conti TeamTNT is using malware normally used in cryptojacking in their attacks.

entry.title: Understanding the Value and Use of Threat Profiles
entry.summary: Defending your organization requires an understanding of who your attackers are, their most likely course of action, and what attacking techniques and methods they would use. Threat profiles are about establishing this context, the parameters and variables that affect your ability to defend effectively.

entry.title: 10 Recommendations To Prepare for an Escalating Cyber Conflict
entry.summary: A list of the Top 10 tips to help organizations protect their IT environment from cyber conflicts related to the war in Ukraine.

entry.title: Anticipating a Russian Cyber Response to Economic Sanctions
entry.summary: A report on how the unprecedented economic sanctions and export controls on Russia, can lead to massive Russian cyber attacks on targets in the West - how and why it could happen.

entry.title: Analysis of CaddyWiper - Wiper Targeting Ukraine
entry.summary: Leading up to and after the war broke out in Ukraine, many destructive cyber attacks have been conducted to disrupt the country's digital infrastructure. This blog post will analyze the latest malware targeting Ukraine.

entry.title: How Do Red Teams Legally Hack Into Banks?
Spring4Shell/SpringShell Spring Remote Code Execution Vulnerability: Impact and Response
entry.summary: Spring Framework is a hugely popular Java application framework, often used in self-contained Spring boot applications, but traditionally often deployed as an application in a servlet container such as Tomcat. A critical vulnerability exists in Spring framework for endpoints that uses data binding to bind requests to Java objects (“POJOs”). This has the potential to lead to remote code execution by passing malicious request parameters to the application. There are publicly available exploits for certain conditions and reports of attacks being performed. Truesec believes other malicious payloads with different behavior will be developed in the near future. A patch has been released by Spring

entry.title: Ransomware Attacks Linked to Russian Sanctions
entry.summary: Truesec has determined that it’s possible that some ransomware gangs are now coordinating their efforts with the Russian government.

entry.title: Russian Hacktivism
entry.summary: The Russian invasion of Ukraine has led to a rise in Russian hacktivism, essentially a form of crowdfunded cyber terrorism.

entry.title: Hybrid Warfare and the Effects of Hybrid Threats on Cybersecurity
The Beautiful Peruvian Jeweller That Turned Out to Be a Russian Spy
entry.summary: Recently several Russian so-called “illegals” have been exposed. Intelligence officers working under deep cover for many years, sometimes for decades. People close to them have had no idea that their life stories have been falsified.

entry.summary: NIST security framework helps secure and protect critical infrastructure from cyber attacks.

entry.title: People Change Over Time − So Does the Human Threat Risk
Fortinet CVE-2022-40684 Vulnerability From an Incident Response Perspective
entry.summary: On October 7 a vulnerability (CVE-2022-40684) in various Fortinet products with a CVSSv3 score of 9.6 was disclosed. It enables an attacker to gain remote, unauthorized access to the management plane of the affected devices. Truesec have spent some time researching and exploring the vulnerability, consequences of exploitation and potential indicators of compromise.

entry.summary: We want to give people who operate in Sweden the best possible conditions to be data-driven in their work regarding risks related to cyber threats so that they can prevent hacking.

Public Sector Report - November
VMware ESXi 8.0 and execInstalledOnly - The Good, the Bad and the Ugly
entry.summary: VMware vSphere 8.0 has execInstalledOnly enabled in ESXi by default, which is great. Unfortunately it's implemented in a way which makes it less effective in preventing ransomware attacks.

entry.title: 5 Hygiene Hacks for IT: Reduce the Risk of Ransomware
entry.summary: You don’t have to blame the lack of budget anymore. Here are steps you can take to quickly improve your security posture – by mostly using the functionality you already have.

entry.title: Skills Needed for an Efficient Cyber Incident Response Team
Find Vulnerabilities in Your IT Infrastructure Before the Threat Actors Do
How To Prevent Ransomware Attackers From Taking Over Your ESXi 8.0 Hosts
entry.summary: This blog post describes a great new security feature in ESXi 8.0 that can prevent a ransomware attacker from moving laterally from your vCenter Server to the ESXi hosts. When implemented properly, this could completely stop one of the crucial steps of a ransomware attack against the vSphere platform.

entry.title: Increased Risk of DDoS Attacks
entry.summary: Recently, many DDoS attacks have been carried out against Nordic companies and authorities. What does the increased risk of being affected mean and how can you as an organization prepare and protect yourself against DDoS attacks?

entry.title: What Is Anonymous Sudan?
entry.summary: Truesec exposes a Russian information operation.

entry.title: Anonymous Sudan: Threat Intelligence Report
entry.summary: Our threat intelligence report (published Feb 20, 2023) explains how the so-called "Anonymous Sudan" has nothing to do with the online activists collectively known as Anonymous. Instead, it was most likely created as part of a Russian information operation to harm and complicate Sweden's NATO application.

entry.title: Amazon Cognito - A Quick Look Into Token Security
entry.summary: If you're using Amazon Cognito to manage user authentication in your application, you should be aware of the permissions users have by default when issued an access token. These could be abused to overwrite user custom attributes, leading to privilege escalation within the application.

entry.title: Threat Intelligence Report 2023
entry.summary: Cybercrime is still on the rise, and the geopolitical situation in Europe is affecting the cyber threat landscape. In our 2023 Threat Intelligence Report, you'll acquire an in-depth understanding of the evolving cyber threats and how to prioritize your cybersecurity investments to minimize your risk moving forward.

entry.title: Exporting Conditional Access Policies As an End User
entry.summary: Recently, We Discovered That There Are Possibilities to Export All Conditional Access Policies in a Tenant Using Nothing Other Than End User Permissions. Meaning, No Admin Privileges are Required to Perform This Operation At All.
